definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself

sentences.english: I rang again and a maid with a sullen face opened the door .
sentences.chinese: 我又揿了一下门铃，一名侍女紧绷着脸把门开了。

sentences.english: As well as fragments of coffin wood and nails, there were four press studs.
sentences.chinese: 另外，除了棺木碎片和钉子以外，还有四个揿扣。

sentences.english: Why didn't you press the switch just now?
sentences.chinese: 刚才你为什么不揿按钮？

sentences.english: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
sentences.chinese: 揿响喇叭提醒其他的司机。

sentences.english: The man with the flat face and the broken nose crushed the end of the cigarette on the table.
sentences.chinese: 长着扁脸和断鼻梁的人在桌上揿灭了烟蒂。

sentences.english: The animals learned to press switch levers with their paws.
sentences.chinese: 动物学习用它们的脚爪揿按开关。

sentences.english: And groping with one hand , she pressed the knob of an electric bell by her beds head.
sentences.chinese: 随后，她用一只手摸索着，揿了一下床头的电铃。

definition: (coll.) to put sth down heavily/to plonk
to knead/to rub/to clear a drain with a pump/to conceal sth in one's bosom/to carry sth under one's coat
to apply (medicinal powder to a wound)/to cover up/to conceal
to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast

short slender pointed piece of metal, bamboo etc/skewer/prod used to extract samples from sacks of grain etc/(dialect) to stick in/to bolt (a door)/to arrange (flowers in a vase)/to graft (tree)/to pedicure/to peel (an apple etc)
drawer/stackable cooking vessel/woven mat on a bed frame or chair/woven window screen
to throw off/to fling sth up (in anger)/refers to dramatic sale prices
